intro: Usteria, commonly known as sea holly, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Goodeniaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive silver-gray foliage and spiky, often blue or purple flower clusters. These plants are typically found in coastal areas and saline environments, showcasing their adaptability to harsh conditions. Usteria species are often used in ornamental gardening for their striking appearance and hardy nature. They play a role in stabilizing coastal soils and supporting local wildlife.
